main event: A bright light was observed by ground radar and visual observers moving irregularly from northeast to southeast at an estimated altitude of 250 feet or less over McAllen, Texas on January 27, 1962.
interesting points: The object was observed to be very brilliant and have an irregular flight path.
The object was tracked on both radar and visually observed.
The object was initially partially obscured by clouds but emerged into clear skies.
Weather conditions at the time included clear skies above ragged topped clouds with scattered cirrus clouds above.
The object was reported to the Air Force and investigated, with the conclusion being that it was possibly a meteor, rocket body, or aircraft.
result: Probable meteor or rocket body entering the atmosphere
